intro: Neoalsomitra pubescens, commonly known as the hairy neoalsomitra, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its small, white flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, spherical berries. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
